alert.note: Alert for Avery; Graham; Haywood; Madison; Mitchell; Swain; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 29 at 12:12PM EST until January 29 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WARNING HAS EXPIRED... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. * WHERE...Western North Carolina counties along the Tennessee border. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A few snow flurries are possible early this afternoon, but no additional accumulation is expected. Untreated roads will remain hazardous through the afternoon. Widespread black ice can be expected across the area through tonight and Sunday morning, especially in shady spots and untreated roads.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Avery; Graham; Haywood; Madison; Mitchell; Swain; Yancey
